intro: Parduyna, commonly known as the "false indigo," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the genus Centaurium and is characterized by its slender stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Parduyna is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
